website_summaries.verdict: A good quality microphone that works with many smartphones and other devices.
pros: Omnidirectional microphone includes a 59-inch 3.5 millimeter cable and comes with 2 muffs and a 1-year warranty

cons: Sound quality is good, but not as clear as some other smartphone microphones

I'm so happy I found this device! It's making my life so much easier! I highly recommend this product.

Great for beginners who want to record voices for videos or interviewing purposes, and it's very easy to use.

customer_reviews.author: Ana L Patino

customer_reviews.title: Great mic for recording videos

customer_reviews.title: Good little mic

This even will allow you to connect to a bluetooth device like hour car stereo and then plug the mic in and it will play music through your stereo and still record through the mic. Super long cord, nice package with instructions. I ended up taking off the fuzzy black. Decent item for price for sure. I feel like it could be a few bucks cheaper but honestly it's not bad at all.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed but it's not bad for the price.

The clip is great though.
customer_reviews.author: Athena

customer_reviews.title: Great Audio !
customer_reviews.text: For a long time I have been recording auditions for myself and friends. One weakness in my recordings was the audio. I finally purchased this one because of the great reviews, and the extra long cord. The plug in adapter was a plus, and was needed. On a test recording, I tried the plug in to my Canon camera, and it did not record audio. After adding the included adapter, it recorded audio, and great audio at that. The long cord also allows me a fair distance from the person being recorded. As far as I know, this does not require a battery. I am very happy with this mic.
customer_reviews.author: Digster

customer_reviews.title: Worked Well for Videos on Cell Phone
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than expected which makes it very easy to transport in your purse or pocket. Comes with little carrying bag. Includes adapter for larger sockets. Can plug it into any normal headphone jack (worked on my new Motorola X4, old HTC phone, Samsung phone, Amazon Fire Ipad, computer for video voice overs). Was not compatible with my older Sony A5000 camera simply because the camera does not have a mike input anywhere. Great for my YouTube videos and filming my kids! Definitely worth the price to try it out yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Traci

customer_reviews.title: A Very Necessary Device
customer_reviews.text: I noticed when I used the microphone in my iPhone 11 if I turned my face away the mic did not pick up my voice very well at all when I was not holding the phone. So, by adding this lapel mic, that problem was solved. Now, even if I turn 180 degrees away from my phone, the lapel mic still picks up my voice. So, this lapel mic is a very necessary addition for anyone recording YouTube videos, for instance. I then ordered a dual mic to use when I "interview" other people. The cord lengths are quite generous and additional pieces were included in a separate plastic bag. These were very smart purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C.

customer_reviews.title: Decent Mic For The Price
customer_reviews.text: I already had one of these when I was asked to do a review of it. I love this little mic. It works well for my YouTube videos and live videos. Sound quality is excellent. No echo. The only issue I have is the mic I was sent to do this review had some cosmetic flaws. The alligator clip was defective/broken. The hook and loop piece came off immediately. The clip and the hook and loop piece are fine on my old mic like this one. I've had my old mic for a couple of years and it is still working fine and all parts are intact. All in all, this mic is a good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product For A Cheap Price

The only real problem i have had with it, is how it picks up the noise from your shirt rustling when you move. Most other issues are mostly from my inexperience with lavs. All in all I would say it's good a quality mic and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: mirayyff

customer_reviews.title: Nice starter mic

I would recommend this mic if you are just starting out making videos and need something that is not expensive, or if you just need something to travel with and you won't hurt your bank if you lose it or break it.

I have been using this for voice recognition software and for online meetings and this works perfectly. The software usually recommends more high end products for much higher prices but this microphone does the job perfectly at much much lower price point. Comes in with extra accessories like additional muffs and adapter for extra additional compatibility. Overall i am very impressed with the product !!!

customer_reviews.title: Started cutting out after first use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this microphone to do live videos. First video, no problem. The second one kept cutting out. I thought maybe it was my shirt blocking it. Third video, I made sure nothing was over it, but people told me I was cutting out. Long sections of my video were almost silent. So I held it carefully in my hand for the rest of the video. That worked better but was still choppy and cut out (more briefly). I'm really disappointed for all the work I went through for those two videos, and now I'm going to have to send this back.
customer_reviews.author: Love to Read!

customer_reviews.title: awesome quality and features for the price
customer_reviews.text: I put three stars for noise cancellation because technically, that's a software feature, and this is a budget mic with no active filtering built in. HOWEVER, it is much less noisy that the PoP Voice I tried. What little background noise that it lets in can be cleaned up in post with SOUND FORGE or other apps that have noise reduction. It comes with an extension cable, an also a TRRS to TRS adapter so you can plug it into your PC for streaming, web calls with Skype/ZOOM/Teams, etc. It comes with a velcro strip and a cloth zip bag to keep it organized & safe.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Jene

customer_reviews.title: Not a good investment

This is not at all good quality and not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Eleana-Sara K.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Smuler/apps

The only thing that might bother you is you’ll hear your voice while singing but who cares as long as it works!! I’ve been looking for a good mic and here it is. You’ll save more than buying the iRig and other stuff!!

customer_reviews.author: Vinnie Langdon III

customer_reviews.title: Just amazing value, solid product

Just overall excellent packaging and product, and tremendous value for the low cost.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander745

customer_reviews.title: Quality build and sound to match.

I used to use a boom mic but I like this much better as I don't have to worry about staying close to the mic. This one picked up my voice very clearly and didn't pick up the background noises of my A/C or outdoor sounds when my window was open. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a good quality mic at a low price. Good mic!

I also ordered an adapter to plug both microphones into my computer and it kept the same quality of sound as if only one was plugged in. So far I’m very happy with them.

But the way I'm using it on quite happy with it especially for how much it cost.
customer_reviews.author: daniel  caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Great value and sound
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Pop Voice lavalier microphone and I can't say enough good things about them. For basic audio recording I don't think you can beat the price of these. I bought this 6' version to compliment my 16' pair because often I don't need an extra long cord. Both have their place, but this shorter version will be perfect to keep in my camera bag because it is so incredibly compact. Note that this lavalier mic is intended for use with a cell phone (TRRS), but they include the adapter that will make it work with your laptop or camera (TRS).
customer_reviews.author: Travis Fellows

customer_reviews.title: Great performing Mic for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a gem to use. The sound quality it's been recording from my phone (Pixel 3XL) and on my wireless Mic set up. Voice has been clear, and the cord length makes it easy to use all around. Comes with an adapter and a couple foam covers. All in all a great package. I want to get another one to replace the one that comes with my wireless mic receivers. Very happy with this purchase for sure, and highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Excellent recording with better clarity
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I tried the microphone for recording with my iPhone. I can definitely tell the difference in the level and clarity of the sounds using this microphone versus the built-in microphone on the iPhone. For most recordings, the built-in microphone would be sufficient. This microphone worked really well during my son's cello recital performance recording and looking forward to using it for his orchestra performance later on.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. Son

customer_reviews.title: Buy cheap, buy twice.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these microphones 2 months ago. I used them 6 times (5 in my room test mode) and yesterday in Studio ... just yesterday in Studio they stopped working ... I made the set up with my Canon 7D camera to automatic and manual mode, and nothing ... microphones just stopped working (after working without problems when I bought them). Perhaps the cable from these microphones is so thin that they probably could have been internally damaged. It is the only explanation that I find. In conclusion, a product of fragile manufacture, do not waste $12-$14 dollars on a product that will leave you lying and in trouble at the time of production.
customer_reviews.author: Cristián B.

customer_reviews.title: Static
customer_reviews.text: Following the directions and using the adapter for connecting to a computer I attempted to talk to my student over Zoom. They could not hear me. Yes, they had un-muted me and my side said that the mic was working. So, I tried a contact mic with my violin just to see if it was my computer - nor problem - they could hear the violin but not the voice. I tried recording with both - the violin recorded just fine, the mic just produced static.
customer_reviews.author: George N. Wells

customer_reviews.text: I record a podcast each week over the phone (Skype, Zoom, etc.) and I needed a backup, so I use the PopVoice Lavalier plugged into a hand recorder of old iPhone. The audio recording quality is actually better than the online/phone platform so I end up using that instead! Great sounding, but the signal runs a little loud on the native Apple Voice recorder app, so I use an aftermarket one that I can adjust the input level. Needs no batteries and can be used with a smartphone (4 ring plug) or in a standard hand held recorder like a Tascam (3 ring plug adapter, included). Highly recommend as I have purchased 3 already.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sheridan

customer_reviews.title: Seller helped out a lot - Very happy now.
customer_reviews.text: This is an edit of my original review** At first, I didn't like it because I thought it didn't work, but the seller contacted me and gave me some tips. They also sent me a newer mic than the one originally purchased which I thought was incredibly nice. The mic works well, you do have to keep it pretty close. If you have an iphone 7, then you need to use the little white adapter that came with the phone. The only thing is that after recording, you have to unplug it which isn't really the mic's fault, it's just something with the phone. Really happy with the seller's service.
customer_reviews.author: S. Obie

customer_reviews.title: This was perfect for what I needed it for and will continue ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I needed to do a speech for my online speech class and all I had was my iPhone to record. I didn’t wanna buy a camera and my computer one wasn’t cutting it. Anyways, I put this on and my voice was clear and everything was understandable. This was perfect for what I needed it for and will continue to use it during the semester. Such a lifesaver!
customer_reviews.author: Alejandra

customer_reviews.title: Fair deal, decent product for beginner
customer_reviews.text: The mic works fine, the additional adapter is a must for laptop (I use a Dell XPS 15). Didn't work without it. The cord was just long enough to get out of the way at my desk. I probably will not be using it as a portable mic. The clip is unusable because the spring is shot. a great deal of force is needed to open the jaw but then it won't close. So mine wouldn't clamp onto anything, not to mention clothes. It is decent mic for beginner use.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kwan

customer_reviews.title: PoP Voice Pro Lav - Buy It!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lav as a few use mic for use at a conference. I am hard on accessories like lav mics and got the PoP based on price and ratings. This mic took much heavy abuse and still looks like new and working like a champ. I’m now using it with me GoPro Hero 8 with the media mod, and the voice quality recordings are awesome, especially in noisy areas and outdoor with wind. Buy this microphone!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Kunkle

customer_reviews.title: Quality  ok, but sound quality is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I might have gotten a defective unit. Sound quality was terrible..muffled. judging bby the way it is made- good for starters, I guess, but If a real lav is what you want... I Honestly would spend the extra money and get a quality piece, like a Rode Lav. This is coming from an older dude with years of experience in the studio. If these are the types of mics you want, then the difference between $25 or $79 isn't really that huge..
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: Sent it back.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this to record podcasts. It only works if it is close enough the the speaker's mouth that there is a risk they will bite it, and I am reasonably certain it is not guaranteed against destruction from biting. Beyond that distance the microphone on my actual iPhone is much better. So, no, don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: The TRS adaptor was trash; made the mic unusable.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried the TRS adapter plug for this mic on three camcorders and a portable audio recorder; the only way it passes signal is if the plug is wiggled half-in, half-out. It's not my equipment, which uses other TRS plugs of this size without problems. The adaptor plug is somehow out of spec or miswired internally. I will try an adaptor from the local electronics shop but if that fails this unit is getting returned.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Paul Suszko

customer_reviews.title: I had no issues with it and it came with a nice bag, and extra wind muffs
customer_reviews.text: For the price and capabilities was worth it. I Thought my tablet would work out of the box with the mic, but the mic included the adapter for my tablet. It worked also well with my phone. Impressed with the sound and quality. I had no issues with it and it came with a nice bag, and extra wind muffs. Kind of wished the mike line was a little bit longer but it is the right size for someone recording onto their phone in a pocket from their lapel.
customer_reviews.author: w Bogaardt

customer_reviews.title: perfect for self taping!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mic, as it is perfect for self taping :)actors know what I'm talking about :) It can be connected to the phone or tablet and record at really good quality and then offload the audio files. it is definitely going to be used as it is so easy to hide so it is not visible when recording and not having to deal with large mics it's a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: C.O

customer_reviews.title: Works with my iPhone 6s
customer_reviews.text: A bunch of people say it doesn't work with their iPhones but it works fine with mine. I use it for live stream vlogging and it makes a very noticeable difference in audio quality. However, I just started using it today. If anything changes I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: jason o

customer_reviews.title: Great Sounding Mic
customer_reviews.text: This budget friendly Lav Mic works great. It picks up your voice very well, loud, and clear. I got this mic to use with my laptop during work video chats and it does the job. I also used it with my android device worked flawlessly. The adapter it comes with did not work with my GoPro. You'll need a TRS to TRRS adapter for it to work with your GoPro. I already had one and it worked Great.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben R

customer_reviews.title: Surprised my the quality of sound
customer_reviews.text: Great quality.wasnt expecting much due to the price but to my surprised it was better then expected. Cord is thick,nothing cheap about it. the connector part is made of metal. Sound is as good as it can get for a generic brand. Putting it against my rode lapel the sound very close to the quality. I'm using it as a backup to my Countryman lapel and ofcourse is not as good but it's not bad...not bad at all.only had it acouple weeks but for the price you cant go wrong
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: great item for a cheap price
customer_reviews.text: Only works well if you are completely still while talking. Any time I moved it while recording it would cut out my voice or distort it. If you need it for something you won’t be moving while doing, great item for a cheap price. If you will be teaching, moving around, or anything else I’d look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny M

customer_reviews.title: Works good with a few adjustments
customer_reviews.text: I used this microphone to voice over my YouTube videos. I thought it was built with good quality and very sturdy, but I found it to sound a bit muffled when clipped onto my shirt as shown. My best results were when I held the microphone 3-4 inches from my mouth without using the clip. I like that it's easy to carry around for travel and if you don't mind holding it up to your mouth, it works pretty good! Very affordable and worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Decent Quality For What I Use it for
customer_reviews.text: I received this mic a few days ago. I have been using it when I record YouTube videos or do voice overs for those videos and it has been working well. I use it with my Samsung Galaxy Note 9 and it has worked great. The sound quality is pretty good on such an inexpensive mic. The cord is very long which is helpful for when I film. Overall i am very happy with the quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for a small mic!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I did not expect this good of quality from a small $13 microphone! I was blown away with the sound output. It’s small, light weight and sounds great! Highly recommend this microphone for anyone in the market but doesn’t want to spend a fortune. Great starter mic for gamers too! You won’t be disappointed and you’ll save your self a lot of money if you purchase this mic
customer_reviews.author: Daniel F

customer_reviews.title: It really works, really!
customer_reviews.text: This mic works great! I have been dissatisfied with several mics that I've used over the years. This mic has restored my confidence in mic tech. It sounds great. Not too treble and not too bass. Update: I accidentally broke the adapter as I stood up and walked away from my work station. POP Voice is taking very good care of me by sending me a replacement adapter. I will buy from them in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Kazimo

customer_reviews.title: Great Microphone
customer_reviews.text: We record FB Live in local restaurants, breweries, and coffee shops. We were using the laptop and getting horrible sound quality, no mic. Yesterday we switched to iPhone 7 with this mic and the sound quality was great. We were on the patio of a local pub, not very busy, music playing, and I did not have to be facing the microphone for me to be heard. There are three of us and one was holding the mic in the middle. We were concerned about the music playing, which could be heard but we were heard better. I would definitely purchase this mic again and have recommended it, already, to multiple people.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great for online video lessons
customer_reviews.text: This cord has come in time of need with Covid-19 locking us down in our homes. As a teacher I have begun to do Lessons at home and the first video my students complained that the audio was too low. The mic came just in time for my second video and the students Immediately gave me feedback telling me the sound quality was much better. For the price this has been amazing. It has saved my sanity and the education of my kiddos.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Blah
customer_reviews.text: I decided to order this although some reviews warned me. You can not hear anything from your phone while this is plugged in. Example: If you have background music/ a chorus/ a lead you will not be able to hear it while you are trying to speak/ sing. You can hear everything afterwards once unplugged. Although the concept is cool and all. Just didn’t work out for what I needed it
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could do my FaceTime videos and it works like a charm. I like that the cord is quite long and you don't have to worry about the length of the cord so much. The recording is very clear and it also works great when I want to dictate on my phone for my writing or communication.Highly recommend this purchase and it is very inexpensive. For its price it packs a punch.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: reliable
customer_reviews.text: you need some quiet to use this, it will pick the tiniest sound! in a studio this is divine, not so much at home. I like it those not perfect but gets the Job done! and did i tell you this is sturdy? As a theater kid who is into sound design, the way i have seen this handled, all my screams amounted to nothing as this ting worked just as new. made me look paranoid. I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Zurat

customer_reviews.title: OK, not great
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping for decent quality but I would say that these are a bit below average. I get tired of wearing a headset all day so though this might be a better option but when on Zoom and other calls, the other participants complain they can't hear me very well or can hear too much background noise. Not great for online meetings that are very long or with a lot of people.
customer_reviews.author: Dana S

customer_reviews.title: Constant clicking found during editing
customer_reviews.text: I've had this microphone for almost 1 year, and use it at least once a week. A couple weeks ago I noticed (when editing the video, not during filming unfortunately) a loud and rapid clicking. It makes my audio completely unusable. It worked well before that, so I can't say it's completely bad. I just feel a mic should have a longer shelf life than 11 months.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: If you are starting out and need a mic that is not going to break the bank look no further. This is a great mic that you can plug into your phone or into an audio recorder like a zoom h1. The sound is perfect for online videos, YouTube, and social media stuff. It has a good cord length that is not going to trip you up. Come with a windscreen already on the mic and you are ready to plug it in and record right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with iPad
customer_reviews.text: Using this with an old iPad2/remote microphone setup in conjunction with Dragon Naturally Speaking on PC. (iPad Pro will not run Dragon Remote Mic which has not been updated by the kind Dragon folks, hence the use of the creaky old iPad2 which gets it done.) Mic seems to pick up normal speech tones just fine. If errors occur, it's because of my speaking voice, not this little microphone. Good value, especially for those of us not wishing to be chained to the desk and want to use a remote mic for dictation.
customer_reviews.author: Howard F. Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Great mic with extras for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lavalier mic for the price. I like the fact that they give you two extra wind muffs since they are usually the first thing to get lost. The adapter allows my mic to feed directly in my digital recorder. (though I had to switch on the "mic power" in settings on my Tascam DR-05) It worked equally well on my CANON DSLR. When I took the adapter off and plugged it straight in to my iphone 6, it too, worked fine. Wire movement noise is fairly minimal. I am using this as a backup mic on video shoots. The sound quality is very good for a budget priced mic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little mic - little difficult getting to work with PC
customer_reviews.text: This mic works great on a PC, once you get it working. Their instructions say to use the black adapter. DON'T. I contacted their tech support. They said you need to use the black adapter. It still wasn't working. I spent about an hour trying to troubleshoot my mic/headphone jack. No joy. I finally decided to try it without the adapter - viola! It works great. So if at first it doesn't work with your PC, try without the adapter. (I have a Windows 10 machine.)
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Nice mic for the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a nice mic for the price . You want to make sure you have it a medium-low otherwise it’s too loud and it can distort the sound also doesn’t cancel background noise. My hubby can be upstairs in the shower and you can still hear it many of times. But for the price not bad does it’s job as long as I keep it on the low - medium volume on my phone
customer_reviews.author: Perkiperkins85

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money like I did!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The seller said, I would get a refund and never got it! This product is terrible. I brought it in September. I just used it last month one time and the stupid thing stopped working. I’m very disappointed as a disabled person who lives in a fixed income money is hard to come by. I made this purchase trusting that it would work a long time. I reach out to the seller because, it way pass the Amazon deadline so, it’s money wasted on this product. Please don’t waste your money. This is my honest review.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Not working.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work for my application. I assumed (like an idiot) that just because it fits the plug that it would work. The mic that came with the radio was crap and all I can find online was an exact replacement of that so I figured given the good reviews on this that I'd give this a try. But nope, doesn't even pick up my voice when I say "hey google".
customer_reviews.author: Wayne P.

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Amazing Quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first external mic. It takes your voice to next level. When I do the recording with my Camera, the sound is awesome. But when I use it on my Macbook it is not that great. It has something to do with the Mac, not a mic problem. But for this price it is really worth. I wonder what the quality would be for the Mics which are selling 100$+.
customer_reviews.author: Britto

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product for the price
customer_reviews.text: First, this not a PROFESSIONAL microphone! Sure, you could spend thousands of dollars on a microphone and if you have that kind of budget, go for it. I bought this to use with my students when I record them on videos because it seems like they talk WAY quieter when you are filming them than when they are on the playground for example. This mic solves that problem. I can clip it on their shirt, plug it in and record away. The mic pics up their voice and I can hear them loud and clear on the recording. I also like the travel bag it includes!! Nice little product.
customer_reviews.author: Eric A. Yerington

customer_reviews.title: Great microphone at such a low cost!
customer_reviews.text: This microphone works amazingly well for such a low price! It includes a bag and an adapter plug for non-cellphone use. I have included an audio test of Pop Voice PV510, in the enclosed video. I compared this inexpensive mic with a much more expensive professional condenser mic so you can hear the difference if any. You then can decide for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: OceanSpace

customer_reviews.title: Good microphone, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the intention of experimenting with setting up a PA system for small room meetings. I was able to connect this microphone to my iPhone using the Apple adapter and then transmit my voice to a connected Bluetooth speaker using an iPhone app called "Microphone". This worked amazingly well except for some feedback due to the speaker location and possibly other factors. I'm still working on the tweaking the system but ,overall, I'm very pleased with the microphone.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: The real deal!
customer_reviews.text: Upon opening the box, I was very impressed with how compact it is, and how nice the carrying pouch is. I hooked it up and recorded my voice. 🤯🤯🤯🤯 that’s high quality right there y’all! News reporting, podcasting quality! Love it!! Totally worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Dbo.

customer_reviews.title: Anatomy Lectures
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my anatomy class. I sit on the second row from my professor. With this product I’m able to get a cleaner audio than just with my IPhone. It cleared out this constant weird white static noise and actually amplified the volume of my recording so I wouldn’t have to put my volume on max on my iPhone. Pro tip. If you buy a water bottle container with a thin handle. You can clip with microphone on there and have double the sound than with it resting on the desk with some discretion.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Can't Beat it for the Price! Great Little Mic.
customer_reviews.text: I record self-tape auditions for TV and Film, and this is perfect for improving the sound quality of my videos. My camera's internal mic is awful, so this really helps me achieve a professional sound at an extremely low price. I'm not sure how well they hold up outdoors, but indoors... Wow, what a difference. It plugs directly into my iphone with an adapter. I record to Voice Memos then sync audio to video in post. So easy to use! I was so happy with my first purchase, I bought another!
customer_reviews.author: AR
